TopicTitle: Surviving high speed impact with water?

Articles.Content: Hello, I'm looking to recreate the re-entry and submerging of the carrier ship from Gundam 00 season 2 but I know of no way to survive an impact of more than 10 m/s let alone something like 300-400 m/s so any ideas?
i don't think you can, it's like hitting the ice or ground, use some parachutes and you'll be fine

It's near impossible to survive an impact at that speed on land*, and water is far more deadly.

I suppose you could make a buoyant 'shield' out of a stupidly large number of radial intakes (they float) and see what happens, but otherwise I don't think what you're asking is possible.

* With structural parts used in the same way intakes might help you with this, it's actually fairly easy to survive an impact at speed; the protected 'payloads' involved tend to be small though.

Yeah it won't work. If you build a shield, the best you'll get is a shield floating alone in the ocean.

Water physics are interesting in this game, as are collision-based destructions. Further, what you want to do would likely not work even in a more reality-based game because something that large hitting water that fast may as well be smacking into the ground.
Have you tried the "no crash damage" cheat?

That reminds me of something:

Have you tried the "no crash damage" cheat?

You'd think so, but even with no crash damage turned on, the parts still get destroyed.

You could go into the configs for each part and set the crash tolerance to something really high. Or better would to use a ModuleManager config to do it automatically without permanent changes. Parts only get destroyed when they hit water at a speed higher than the crash tolerance. Don't ask me how to do it with ModuleManager, I don't ever mess with configs.
